Description: Triangular handle-ornament from a mould-made pottery lamp, decorated with a bust of Sarapis on a globe, flanked by the starred caps of the Dioskouroi. Hollow. Plaster mould. Light red brown fabric with mica and white inclusions and a grey core. Buff surface, covered with an orange-red slip.
Curator's comments: Bailey dates this type to the Roman Period, based on its similarity to Broneer Type 21 (Broneer 1930; 1977), though Egyptian types tend to be bigger (Bailey 1988, 219). Broneer, O. 1930. Corinth IV.II, Terracotta lamps, Princeton. Broneer, O. 1977. Isthmia III, Terracotta lamps, Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1924)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (864)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.13) (Phase 1)
